comment: I love this professor. I have had her for almost all of my math classes at KSU. She will go above and beyond to help her students. She is always open to tutoring hours and offers additional points for the whole class. There was a cummulative final for this class, and there is a lot of homework on Aleks

I took Dr. Watson for Pre-calc and she was always available to answer questions (replied to emails within 12 hours) and had zoom sessions if you needed more help. ALL her notes are available on D2L along with old lecture videos, but I still recommend coming in person as her lectures are helpful. She's very understanding as well & gives extensions.

Dr. Watson is a very understanding professor. Attendance is not required but encouraged. She is very understanding and always tries to help you in whatever way possible. She is very allowing for you to use a Cheat sheet during her tests which can have anything you want on it. If you find Math hard, please take Dr. Watson!

TAKE HER! YOU LITERALLY CANT FAIL WITH HER AS YOUR PROF!!! she uses aleks for hws assignments. uploads ALL notes to d2l if you miss a class. literally is the most understandable, reasonable and realistic math professor within this whole campus... jus take her.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: She's a good teacher just wish she would've gave me more slack than she did when I came back from having COVID. She can also be a hard grader literally if you forget to put a degree symbol, shell deduct points. Overall a cool teacher though.
I love Dr. Watson. Very easy class for me. Just pay attention in class and do the ALEKS. Quizzes are based off of what the lectures are. We can use a note card for the test

While the class itself can be tough especially with ALEKS being problematic, if you get in the hang of the class and stay productive and resourceful, you will succeed. Dr. Watson is most certainly a very caring teacher and a great lecturer. Ask questions too! Pro tip: Stay after class for some interesting math history if she talks about it!

I loved her! I can understand why people say she goes fast, but she will GLADLY slow down if you ask her. Can use a notecard on tests. Quizzes are online and they are based off activity sheets we do in class, so you have the answers already. ALEKS wasn't too bad for me personally, but I wouldn't recommend procrastinating. I'd take her again!

Dr. Watson was very good about teaching her material and making sure everything was posted for students to study with. She also gives partial credit on answers and is lenient with late work. She tries to give her students as many points to bump up their grade as she can. You get to bring an index card to tests which helps. ALEKS sucks tho.

Dr. Watson is an overall great choice for precalculus. She always gives partial credit on tests and provides thorough study guides for each test listing every topic. She moves at a fast pace, but she'll wait if you ask her to. ALEKS is a pain, but if you do your homework and go to class the tests are honestly pretty reasonable by comparison.
Very helpful and understanding professor. She will give you the dates of every assignment and exams are easy if you do the homework.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Awful teacher. Fast teaching, talks fast. If youre slow at doing math dont take this teacher. Tests are hard, no review sheets to help. Everyday is notes and those are long and complicated. Have to take the test in person. Highly dont recommend she will fail you.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Honestly many says she's fast but really if you focus enough, she does things at quite an amazing pace. I missed a few classes, due to some health issues and she was very understanding. My car even broke down and she let me take my exam on a different date. Also very good lecturer. Just do your part and you'll be fine.

Best math teacher I have her had! She gives partial credit and you can make a notecard for each test. You get a week to finish homework that is graded by completion. She is always willing to help or re-explain anything.

Dr Watson is the best math teacher I have ever had. She is a very thorough teacher and only goes over one or two topics each class. If you ask her questions she will know you on a first name basis and is always available to help. The homework is all online and the program kind of sucks but its the schools rules and not hers. Love this teacher

She is amazing at explaining concepts and is extremely thorough while making sure everyone is keeping up with her lectures. ALEKS does kind of stink but every teacher uses it, she is super nice and clearly wants to help all students succeed in her class. Would recommend her to anyone who doesn't like math, she makes it simple.

Prof Watson was the one teacher that finally made precalc stick. She made it easy to understand and not only that she helped a lot outside of class as well. The only complaint is the homework software used. ALEKS is a mess.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: MAKE SURE YOU DO ALL THE ALEKS HOMEWORK!! Doing all of the homework will really be the difference between a C and an A in this class. She usually ends class early, but is always willing to help if you don't understand something by staying after class. She was very lenient with extensions for work too. Great professor!

All you need to do is pay attention and take good notes. The quizzes are really easy, and ALEKS really helps with the tests. Only thing is, make sure you dont miss any ALEKS assignments. She gives ALOT of them.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Amazing professor! She loves to answer your questions and really wants you to learn the information. There are 3 take-home tests and there is homework on ALEKS basically every week. Tests are hard deadlines, make sure you turn them in on time! There are also quizzes every week and if you do the activity sheets you will be fine.

She's a great teacher, really caring and goes above and beyond to make sure things are understood ! She helps when you need it ! The class wasn't as bad as I thought it'd be, I got a C which is fine because math definitely just isn't for me but I'd take her again if I needed to !

Hands down the reason I got an A in this class is because Dr. Watson is an incredible professor. She wants her students to succeed. All tests were take home and she gave four days to complete, quizzes each week with questions that came directly from class activities. Tons of HW but she will drop your lowest HW. If math makes you nervous take her!

honestly she didnt teach everything that would be on the homework, but would always end class early. math is my strongest subject and i had a hard time because i was teaching myself. the homework is through ALEKS which makes me question my life choices because its so time consuming. show ALL work on tests or she takes a lot of points off
Shes a good professor and is really nice. Im not good at math but she was able to make everything more cleat to me.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Homework due every week on Aleks. Mathway is great. Aleks does have you do check ups and if you mess up a problem you have to go redo the section that you did week ago. Quizzes with 4-5 questions on d2l once a week that are easy. I am awful at math but she made this class really easy for me. There's 3 tests, all take home and you have 3 days to do

I hate math more than more than Pepsi and Coke hate each other. But, Watson made it bearable. I've majored in a different subject, so I don't have a math background, however I still made an A. I'd recommend to do every HW assignment. Those are more helpful than the actual test guides. Also, in my class she replaces out lowest exam with the final.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Watson is the best professor I have ever had. She teaches the material very thoroughly and actually wants her students to do well. She also allows a full sheet of paper as a cheat sheet for each test. Attendance is not mandatory, but she grades participation by a few in-class questions, so make sure to check the lecture notes to see.

Easiest class. She's a very sweet person and genuinely cares about her students doing well in her class. Do the homework and ALEKS because it will make the exams easier. The only time you use the textbook is when she assigned homework.

I hate ALEKS, but that's what the math dept at KSU thinks we all need, so... ALEKS made my life miserable, but Dr. Watson was sweet and caring and did her best to make herself accessible to all students. I find math EXTREMELY DIFFICULT and was able to pull an A, but it was a miracle getting here. On top of ALEKS, she has her own HW... Be prepared.

Professor Watson is a great professor. She makes sure that everyone understands what she is teaching and will re-explain something if you do not get it. She also allows an entire sheet of paper for a cheat sheet on most tests. I would take her for Algebra if you can!
Amazing professor who makes lectures entertaining and easy to understand. She puts a great amount of effort into helping outside of class and gives plenty of opportunities to get help.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: I really enjoyed Dr. Watson's class this semester. Her notes are accessible outside of class and during tests, she will allow you a cheat sheet sometimes. Her office hours are given and she usually stays after class to help anybody confused. She is a very sweet lady ans really wants you to understand the math.

Dr. Watson was the best math teacher I have ever had. For trig, there are many opportunities to get a 100 in the grade book. She let my class have a cheat sheet for all tests including the final. I took this class at night class, and she always let us out fifteen minutes or more before class was scheduled to end. She offers many office hours.

Shes a great teacher if you want a class that isnt too hard. If you listen in class or are good at math then its very easy. She did use ALEKS though which sometimes didnt work, and her tests are very short so be prepared. All in all a good choice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: One of my favorite teachers! she is kind, caring (she knew us all by name by the second week), and will work with you to get where you need to go. There is a lot of weekly homework, I spent close to 9 hours a week working with the homework program ALEKS which wasn't terrible as long as you stayed on top of it. Be prepared to work for your grade!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: I'm in this class and the teacher is so caring and learns all of our names and is 100% willing to work with you if you are struggling. She will give you an extension on homework if you really need it. She also never makes you feel stupid for not understanding and is willing to take the time to work with you. She also is a really fair grader!

Ms. Watson is awesome. I am not very good at math and needed a C in this class to move on. She gives 3 test and a final. She will replace your lowest test grade with the final grade if its higher. She gives plenty of homework points, I advise you guys to do all the homework because it will allow you to do not so good on the test and still pass!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is great!! I was a dual enrollment student taking her class and I never struggled. She lets you have an entire printer paper, front and back, as a cheat sheet on tests. Her review sheets tell you every possible topic that could be on the test, so you are aware of absolutely everything you need to know. She has extra points built in.

Professor Watson is really sweet. Her grading is amazing (homework is worth just as much as the tests). She lets you have a cheat sheet for each test. The only complaint is that she teaches really fast, and we frequently had to tell her to slow down.

DO THE HOMEWORK it's such a huge part of your grade, so if you do it, there's a good chance you'll get an A. She posts all of her notes online and attendance isn't mandatory, but go to class so you understand. She ends class early all the time and is always willing to help. She wants her students to ask questions and succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: SO awesome!!! Professor Watson really cares about her students and takes the time to explain to you if you don't understand something. I am not a math person but I still made an A because I put in the effort and Professor Watson noticed and worked with me about it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Loved this class. Prof Watson is a great math teacher, shes very helpful and explains well. shes a total math nerd with cheesy jokes but I love that. HW assignments every few classes but they are easy and she gives the second half of EVERY class to work on HW/ask Q's or u can leave if u want. test 3 and final allow cheat sheet. HW is main grade. EZ

This class was quite the challenge but she is a good professor. She mostly teaches new concepts through examples. She dedicates half the class time (most days) to helping students with their work so you have a lot of time in class to do the with homework and get help. LOTS of homework. This class is good for those talented at math. Would take again
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Watson made Precalculus easy. As long as you do the homework, which she allows you to do in groups, you'll probably pass. The homework counts more than any tests by the end of the semester and the tests themselves are just like the test reviews she gives. You can use a cheat sheet on the final and she posts all her class notes.. TAKE HER.

Dr. Watson is seriously the best math teacher I have had. She made the concepts so easy to understand, and math is not my strong suit. She really seems to care about her students, just don't be afraid to ask for help!

To me the class was an easy A as your hw counts as most of your grade. We had one hw assignment worth 3x as many points as the final. She also let us use a cheat sheet on the last test and the final. Although, you do have to explain all your answers in sentences. She is a super sweet lady, but her teaching often felt confusing to me.

She was incredible and I wish she taught Calc. If you get confused on anything just ask for help and she will help you. She is such an amazing person and this was a great recap in Trig for me. If you are bad at math, take this professor because you will be able to pass. Once again, Professor Watson is amazing and I love her.

One of the best math professors you will find. She is so good explaining and she always stops if you need help. She is always available and cares. The only thing you need to be aware of, is that you will need to write explanations for your answers.

Dr. Watson is great if you struggle with math. Her lectures are very clear and she will stop to explain anything if you need it. She is also very accessible outside class and has office hours multiple times a week. She uploads all her lectures to D2L. Homework is my math lab and she replaces your lowest test grade with final grade if it's higher.

She's the best math professor I've ever had. No memorizing unit circle. Let's you use notes on tests. But best of all, she actually cares. Show the effort and you will make a very high A. Homework helps weigh bad test grades. Has mandatory "exit questions" for attendance but it's group work so you can have someone write your name.

Only gotten a B because I was unaware of two online assignments. Homework is like half your grade, and exams are the other half. She can help you a little bit during exams. Great professor, explains things well, doesnt go fast. Easy A

She is very kind but the homework is counted for half of your grade, and the 3 tests and the final are the other half (400 + 400  800). You have to write an explanation for each problem and it is hard to get a good grade on the homework.

Dr. Watson was fantastic. She has been my favorite professor thus far. She truly cares about everyone in the class passing, and does everything in her power to help you succeed. There are daily quizzes, however, she makes it very well known what material will be covered on it, so it is easy to do well on those. It is a work heavy class, but easy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Absolutely loved Professor Watson! She is such a sweetheart and is willing to help with anything. She is great at answering questions! I've never been too great at math, but Professor Watson made it soooo easy to understand. There are online hw assignments, DO THEM, they really boost your grade. Tests are easy. Come to class, pay attention, do HW
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Would take again

comment: This is the best math professor I've personally ever had. She is incredibly kind, and is gifted at teaching mathematical concepts clearly. She learns everyone's name, and the class feels very personal. If you read this Virginia - you rock!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Would take again

comment: This class is extremely easy if you pay attention to lectures and complete the exit questions at the end of every class. She gets to know you and will know everyone by name by the end of the semester. Answers emails quickly. Overall a great person and I enjoyed her class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--Would take again

comment: Instead of attendance she uses "exit-questions" to give a grade for that day which is why attendance is kinda mandatory but kinda not. Her tests are easy and short but all free response. She always lets out early if you get done in time. She is always willing to help you understand. You will need the book or the online book for sure.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Watson is the best math teacher ever! 3 tests, some online homework, and occasional quizzes to see if you're showing up to class. Although she knows everyone by name. Her class is very easy, I made C's on all the tests and still ended up with an A in the class. She is more than willing to spend her time on you to make you successful. Take her!!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Watson is such a caring professor. She wants you to succeed. She takes attendance by quizzes, so you have to show up but the quizzes are not difficult. She also never keeps you the full class. I had over a 100% average for most of the semester because she drops grades at the end. She also cracks a couple jokes throughout the class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Would take again

comment: Dr. Watson is the best math professor I've had at Kennesaw. She has so much opportunity for "fluff" grades that I made C's on the first two tests and still had a 98 in the class. Teaches material in such a way that everyone understands. If you don't, she is more than happy to stay after class (even 45 minutes after class!) Take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Very simple to understand. She posts notes from class which helps a TON. She is very nice and a night owl. I have her for a night class and she is still wide awake and perky.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Wonderful teacher, and teaches concepts clearly.  She really tries to make sure the class learns the material, and she has a good heart.  Would totally take again.

Dr. Watson is a very caring person and is happy to answer any question you have. She is helpful during class and during her office hours. She allows you to work in groups in class and allows a one page cheat sheet (front and back) during her tests. The only con I have for her is even though she tells you your work is solid, her grading may differ.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Watson, is very caring and an awesome professor. She makes sure you actually know the material.
Great teacher

Dr. Watson has been my favorite teacher I have experienced thus far. She is caring and will help to guide you through anything you don't understand if you ask. She posts all class notes online so you can more easily study after class. The weekly homework was easy and worth a large amount of your grade. If you study and prepare you will get an A.

This class is so easy. If you show up to class it is hard to not make an A since homework/classwork is worth more than tests. She is the sweetest and most caring woman. You don't learn anything but will definitely make a good grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: I love this woman. She is very knowledgeable, and dedicated to helping students learn. I am not good at math and ended up with a great grade in this class. Take her!

Very nice but does not explain problems whatsoever so you are left to learn everything from the textbook on your own. Thankfully though, in her college trigonometry class you are able to use a cheat sheet on every one of her tests which is amazing. Overall, I didn't think she was a very good teacher, but she's sweet.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: very strict about phones and calculators. Not great at explaining problems. Patronizing. Overall not a great teacher unless you love math and it comes easily to you
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Watson is literally the best! She is so kind and caring. She takes the time to learn everyones names and genuienly cares about how you do in her class. Her test are only 15 to 20 questions and you are able to use a cheat sheet on some of the tests. She is always willing to help if you don't understand. Such a great teacher!

Professor Watson is literally the best professor I have ever taken in my life! If you have to take precalculus, she is definitely the best professor to take. She is very caring, and really makes sure that everyone understands. Really wants to give you an A.

Dr. Watson is an amazing professor! She genuinely cares about every student. She takes the time to learn everyone's names and interact with each student. She posts notes from each class on D2L, which makes it easier to study. MyMathLab homework every week, but not hard.

Dr. Watson was definitely my favorite professor! She is a very kind, approachable, and bubbly professor. She will help you with Math if you just ask. Make sure you do your homework. I had a total of nine homework grades, all online, all unlimited tries. You have, I think three quizzes and four tests. It's an easy class! She's a great professor.

Dr. Watson does not teach much in class unless you specifically ask her questions however she is brilliant. She made up her own website where you turn homework in on and homework counts the same if not more than a test.  So if you turn in the homework in on time and get 100's on them, you should be able to get an A. I just didn't learn anything.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Watson was a fantastic instructor for math 1113. She cares about her students and accommodates for them via office hours, in class help, or just through email. Attendance is not mandatory but if you go and answer the socrative correctly you get points for the class which end up adding up. Great instructor and great choice for this class!

Her class is not hard at all. She just doesn't teach very much. You have around 2 to 3 modules due a week with anywhere from 30 to 100 questions on them. Her test are not hard either. I will come out with a really good grade but i did not learn very much. It is an EASY A!

I loved Dr. Watson's class. At times, her lectures were slow, but she really cares about her students and wants you to understand the material. There's weekly homework assignments and about 4 tests. She takes notes in class and posts them online. She also gives you a cheat sheet to write down formulas for the final. Take her!

Dr. Watson is a very nice lady and learns everyone's name. She grades attendance but it for such a small percentage of your grade that it won't matter. DO THE HOMEWORK. Homework is hard but that and the tests are weighted the same so don't stress over tests as long as you do the homework. Tests are multiple choice. She curves everything.

She is an awesome in a sense of character. Her class isn't too bad. Attendance is not mandatory but recommend. Her explanation can quite helpless sometime. I don't get the way she count points for total grade but not a hard teacher. She has been teaching for awhile and know what she is doing. Would like to take her for probability and inference.
She's pretty nice teachers. For my semester tests were take home, but they can take a good amount of your time.  If  you use her notes, an look at the examples from the book you'll do fine.

She stopped the full page cheat sheet in Math 1113.  You might be better off taking Riley.  He curves all of his tests.  She's homework heavy, but if you study every night and do all of the homework and go to math tutoring, you might get an A.

I really enjoyed Professor Watson. She cracks a lot of corny jokes throughout lecture and she is just fun to learn from. She is incredibly understanding, and if you need to miss class it is okay. You get a full page cheat sheet on the tests that you can write anything on. Not hard if you pay attention and do My Math Lab/homework etc. Sweet lady

Dr. Watson is an outstanding professor. She was always there when I needed help. She learns everyone's name. 10-15 question test. Cheat sheet 8.5x11 both sides. 3 test and the final. Teaches in a way you will truly understand. DEFINITELY take her.
really good teacher and really helpful. would defiantly recommend. she is very easy going and laid back teacher and one of my only teachers who actually learned everyones name. Very helpful

Dr. Watson is a good math teacher; she gives good explanations in class and offers as much help as you need outside  of class. Her tests are only 10-15 questions, but she lets you use a cheat sheet (8.5x11 sheet of paper, anything you want can be written on it front and back). She assigns a lot of homework on my math lab. Overall she's pretty good.

She is so great. Whenever I can take her, I do. She is so helpful and really interested in the subject she teaches. Ive had her for stat 1107, discrete, and graph theory. She is a wonderful teacher and prepares you for the tests - which are 7 questions. The book was kinda helpful but it made you prove things you don't know yet.

Dr. Watson is a wonderful person, but is not the best teacher for Trig, due to the fact she has not taught it in 10+ years. Although sometimes she is not very clear, she is always ready to help her students and ALWAYS LETS CLASS OUT EARLY. Show up for class, ask questions, and study hard.
she was great

She's fantastic. I'm not a math person at all and was scared about taking statistics. Her teaching was so clear that I not only enjoyed the class, I made an A! I'm an adult learner who hadn't taken math in decades, trust me, don't take stat with anyone but her. Homework prepares you well for the tests and she allows a 1 pg. cheat sheet. LOVED her!!

Watkins is cool af; she's one on the nicest professors I've ever taken. She's good at teaching and genuinely wants you to do well. Lots of homework, but a good portion isn't graded. A few tests, but you get to create a cheat sheet. Attendance isn't mandatory. If you take any other professor for stats, you're crazy.

This class was very hard for me. I understood 50% of the materials she covered. It seemed like 95 percent of the students did well on her test. I do not blame her, I blame myself. I am just terrible in math, if you are not terrible in math like me, I would recommend her. I think she is a good teacher, and I am just terrible in statistic.
Tests have 6-8 questions. That's it. Miss 1 or 2, you're done. She is helpful, but her test REALLY need many, many more questions so that we have at least a fighting chance!
Great professor. The only professor this semester that was any good. Definitely take her for this class.
Mrs. Watson is very clear about what she expects from her students, so make sure you go to class and pay attention. She is sweet and loves her subject.
Very easy and helpful teacher, but you should definitely attend class if you can't learn it on your own. Super sweet lady.

I'm not very good at math, but I still managed to make an A in this class. My trick was writing very detailed cheat sheets on microsoft word. You're allowed 1 page. Be prepared to explain all your answers. The second half of the semester gets rather tough too. She posts the tests' answer keys, so this helps with your understanding for the final.

This teacher was amazing! She requires that you explain all your work! If your great with the subject you'll do fine! Her teaching style actually grabs my attention and makes me interested in the class. I loves my class with her!

Dr. Watson is so incredibly helpful! I hate statistics but I honestly enjoyed her class. She assigns a lot of work, but she lets you use a cheat sheet on every test. Her class was not easy, but if you stay on top of your work you will definitely get an A. Go to her office hours; they are very helpful for last minute questions before the test!

Professor Watson was a very nice teacher. She did a great job explaining things and you could tell she knew and enjoyed what she was talking about. Even if you hate statistics or have no idea about it, this class isn't hard. You can tell she wants you to understand. She even lets you use a cheat sheet on every test.

Dr. Watson is fabulous! I had no interest in statistics, and at times I found the subject hard to comprehend, but Dr. Watson is so helpful. She is one of the most positive people I have ever met. She loves her job, and it shows.  Absolutely take her!

Professor Watson is great! Statistics is a class everyone dreads and not only did I do well in her class, I enjoyed it. Attendance is not mandatory, but helpful. Homework due once a week (VERY short & lets you work in a group) and three tests. She loves what she does & is ALWAYS willing to help. I'll definitely take her again if I have the chance!
Excellent instructor.  Very helpful.  I enjoyed her class. She went above and beyond to help us understand.  Great teacher overall.

By far this is not an easy A.  You have to work for it.The great thing about Professor Watson is that her tests are similar to her homework problems and thank goodness for the CHEAT SHEET.She is an Excellent teacher.She is great at answering your questions if you are having a tough time understanding how to do a problem. My favorite teacher so far.

I'm having a hard time with this class, but it is in no way this teacher's fault. She is helpful, kind, funny, and genuinely cares about her students. She lets you use cheat sheets on the tests. TAKE HER!!!

Dr. Watson was so wonderful! I am a terrible math student normally but she made everything extremely clear, posted all notes online, and was almost too patient with some of the questions people asked. I got an easy 96. AND I felt like I learned!

Grade class and great teacher. I went in with indifferent expectations and left with a greater understanding of the world around us. I was amazed at the influence of statistics in our everyday lives. Do the homework,take good notes and practice and you'll be well on your way to enlightenment and A.If you're less nerd than I, you'll still like class

Prof. Watson is great! The only thing I didn't like about the class was the writing part but other than that she is very sweet and she will help you if you need the extra help. She always seems happy and she is very smart. I hate math and I came out with a B+

Dr. Watson is, without a doubt, one of THE BEST professors at KSU.  You put forth the effort and she will guide you through a subject that can be quite tough.  Two bits of advice though, act like a college student not a 5th Grader and Friday, Friday, Friday!  Take Dr. Watson on Friday if she is teaching on Friday and make friends for group work.

Wonderful professor! She is very helpful and allows a cheat sheet for tests. I hate math but she made it interesting and easier for me to stay focused. If you struggle in math then this is the professor for you.

I took her for Stats. She was very energetic and fun, well as fun as stats can possibly be. Her tests are difficult but her class work and homework is easy. I never went to a study session and ended the class with a B. I was only one point away from an A overall. I would recommend her. Just do the homework!

Awesome lady and great professor. Really enjoyed the class. I DIDN'T have to worry about lame math class with a monotone professor. You can tell she really enjoys teaching and is very willing to help. TAKE HER!

She is a sweetheart! Great teacher, very clear, smart, sweet! Not a lot of homework, tests pretty easy plus u can have a cheat sheet! She is a very nice person, smiles all the time and Im glad im takin stats with her! 10/10

Im currently taking this class. Dr. Watson paces this course very fast. We have a Supplemental Instructor and she is awesome at explaining the material, providing practice handouts, and preparing you for everything on the exams. I have made A's on everything b/c of S.I. If your class has it, use it! As a nursing majors I need an A!

Absolutely wonderful professor! I highly recommend her; I took her late at night during the week.  She made it extremely interesting.     She is committed to a student?s success. I got an A on final and B overall.  I can not say enough good things about her.  Take her and you will not be sorry!

Great professor! Allows a cheat sheet on exams and is very helpful when you get confused. She assigns homework every week, but usually only 2 problems. Group work is also completed every other week. Take her if you have to take STATS!!! You won?t be sorry!! Get the solutions book too - SO HELPFUL!

She was always willing to slow down or go over something again if we were confused. She gave us a lot of bonus assignments and allowed us to take a "cheat sheet" into the tests. If you go to class and take good notes, it is not hard to make an A.

Although attendance is not mandatory by the instructor, it is if you want to do well.  She spells everything out very clearly, and helps as much as possible with problems you may be having.  Homework grade counts as much as one test, but it's only a couple of problems. 2 tests, midterm, and final & final replaces lowest grade. definately recommend.
Not a very good teacher. Is not clear in her instructions and can be vary confusing.  Is available for help but not very helpful. Do not take this professor

I suck at math and this class was awesome. You don't have to do that much math, there is a calculator method for almost everything. The homework is easy, it is just a few problems that you turn in - I never did the assigned homework, only what was required to turn in. The review sheets before the test are helpful and focus your studying.

Absolutly loved this class. If you attend the classes, take notes, and do the hw it is an easy A. She gives group assignments that you do in class. Explain in detail your answers and you will be fine. Test are EASY. She is presentable and willing to help. Cancels class from time to time but will put message up on web-ct. Has study guides. fun class
She is an excellent instructor but you must do the homework that is assigned otherwise it will hurt your final grade in the end. For the tests, really focus on her examples and homework problems.
Extremely easy, short classes. She does cancel a lot, but I guess there's not that much to do. Her homework policy is INFLEXIBLE, so don't mess around with that and you will be fine.

Dr. Watson is absolutely one of the nicest teachers EVER! If you study the material then the test will be a breeze, she also expects explanations of problems in detail..I took her for a friday class and made an A..not an easy one but it is attainable

I made an A because I did as she did. You must write everything in excruciating detail. The tests are not hard if you are familiar with the problems she did in class.It bugs me that she cancels class often without warning. I guess this is not a problem for most students, and it's apparently a pattern with her from what I hear.

It's a very hard class.  The tests are not fair, gives only 5 to 7 questions and one question can be worth 30points.  So if you screw up one question your gone.  The tests are essay type.  Dont ever take this class in this campus.  Take it somewhere else because she is the only one who teaches this class which is not fair.
EASY! Take notes. Turn in homework! She is very nice and helpful. Test were a breeze without studying! EASY A
Easiest Math class I have ever taken....if you can get this prof, do!! She is extra nice and  you hardly do any work, but you will learn the material.

This was the easiest math class I have ever taken! I easily attained an "A" in the class. Her test are clear and easy and she is always willing to help. She is adorably nerdy! I enjoyed her class and highly recommend her.

Dr. Watson is not an easy A by any means, but if you work hard, an A is very possible, even probable. The material is dry and tedious by its nature, but she did a good job of explaining things and seems to know her stuff. Tests are very fair, and homework is critical. She is a bit high pitched, but it's always fun to hear her bad jokes.
Great teacher, very helpful, very clear, give you good examples. Test are good, takes notes and do your homework and you'll do fine in the tests.

She is very easy and helpful. She lets you use cheat sheets on her tests, this was for summer school so I am not sure if she lets you for regular classes. Take her during the summer. I actually enjoyed her class, just be sure you go to class and take notes. Her notes are very helpful. She is always there if you need her.

Mrs. Watson is nice and all, but with a class of 30 students, she didn't have much time to help me out.  Also, I am an idiot at math, and I believe she paced the material rather quickly.  She is anything but an easy A.
I'm sure if you pay attention in clas, take compitent notes and study just a little, you will do just fine in the class.

The voice IS high pitched, but beyond that shes always willing to help.  Be sure to write down everything she does on the board and ask questions.  She also lets your final grade count twice to replace your lowest grade.  Go to her office, email her, and ask stuff til you understand. It can be done!
She has a very high pitched voice that can be annoying soemtimes. Easy class, easy tests. I made a B in that class & i didnt do good on the final...
